meanings.definition: The condition of being restricted or peculiar to a particular place or region.
meanings.sent1: The endemisms of this island make it a unique place to study biodiversity.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the endemisms of different regions to understand their ecological significance.
meanings.sent3: The endemisms of the desert seemed to have a secret club that only locals knew about.
meanings.sent4: The endemisms of the rainforest are like treasures hidden in a vast green chest.
meanings.sent5: Exploring the endemisms of the ocean depths is like discovering a hidden world.

meanings.definition: A plant or animal species that is native to a particular area and found nowhere else.
meanings.sent1: The conservation efforts focus on protecting the endemisms of this mountain range.
meanings.sent2: Tourists come to see the unique endemisms of this national park.
meanings.sent3: The endemisms of the forest had a party and invited all the local critters.
meanings.sent4: The endemisms of the savannah are like rare jewels in a vast grassland.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of the endemisms in this valley is truly breathtaking.
